contentList.content: The strong embrace the wild that hides inside - keen instincts, primal physicality, and most of all, an unbridled, unquenchable rage.
Jump up, down, and across. Your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> affects how far you can jump.
You have -5 to your second attack roll this turn. If your weapon is light, reduce this to -4.
You slash your hand through the air, channeling miniature ripples of air from each finger to slice your enemy
Project a puff of noxious gas.
Hurl the conjured flame in your hand at a target and let it sizzle out.
Throwing the flame this turn doesn't cost an action. Throwing it on subsequent turns will cost an action.
Reduces the target's <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [1].
Throw a bubble of acid that damages each creature it hits.
You temporarily morph your limb into a clawed appendage.
You call upon the Void to harm life force
An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another.
You call down a tendril of lightning that cracks with thunder
Enemies are off-guard to your attacks.
Cannot take reactions and has one less action.
Creature is off-guard. Range of attacks and spells reduced to [1].
Violence is both a means and an end. You follow a path of untrammelled fury, slick with blood, as you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own well-being.
Your attunement with nature and its beasts inspires your rage, empowering you with supernatural might.
Bards know music is more than idle fancy - it is power. Through study and adventure, these travelling troubadours master song, speech, and the magic within.
You pursue beauty and truth, collecting knowledge from scholarly tomes to peasants' tales, and use your gifts to hold both audiences and enemies spellbound.
You wander the land to witness and relate the deeds of the mighty, keeping alive the memory of heroes of the past and inspiring heroes of the future.

Deities work their will upon the world in infinite ways, and you serve as one of their most stalwart mortal servants. Blessed with divine magic, you live the ideals of your faith, adorn yourself with the symbols of your church, and train diligently to wield your deity’s favored weapon. Your spells might protect and heal your allies, or they might punish foes and enemies of your faith, as your deity wills. Yours is a life of devotion, spreading the teachings of your faith through both word and deed.
Tasked with the holy edict of preserving the body, mind, and soul, your god grants you a plethora of healing magics.
Gods of primordial flame bathe you in resplendent light, providing magics to dispel darkness and immolate enemies.
You wield the unorthodox divine tools of deceit and illusion in worship of your chosen deity.
Druids channel the elemental forces of nature and share a deep kinship with animals. Mastery of Wild Shape allows them to transform into beasts from all over the Realms.
You channel the natural arcana flowing through the earth and creatures atop it to cast powerful druidic magic.
Your form is mutable as the mercurial moon, letting you shift your form into massive beasts and even primal elementals.
Fighters have mastered the art of combat, wielding weapons with unmatched skill and wearing armour like a second skin.
As a paragon of tactical superiority, you employ a wide array of combat manoeuvres to dominate every fight.
You are a warrior of spell and sword, weaving incantations that supplement your extensive martial expertise.
Some reach enlightenment by languid meditation - others do so in the heat of battle. Monks manipulate ki to empower their own strikes and debilitate their foes.
A promise made so deeply that it becomes divine in itself flows through a paladin, burning bright enough to inspire allies and smite foes.
You fight on the side of light in the cosmic struggle against darkness to preserve the sanctity of life and the beauty of nature.
Following the ideal of the knight in shining armour, you act with honour and virtue to protect the weak and pursue the greater good.
You have broken your sacred Oath in pursuit of power and ambition. Only darkness remains to fuel you now.
Rangers are unrivalled scouts and trackers, honing a deep connection with nature in order to hunt their favoured prey.
You foster an intelligent bond with a powerful beast that can aid you in and out of combat.
You seek the most dangerous prey in Faerûn, from ancient dragons to massive hordes of undead, and excel at slaying them all.
With stealth, skill, and uncanny reflexes, rogues' versatility lets them get the upper hand in almost any situation.
Your quick hands and mastery of the larcenous arts make stealing second nature - be it from a third floor window or a forgotten ruin.
As quick with a spell as you are with a lockpick, your illusions and enchantments keep opponents on the back foot.
Sorcerers are natural spellcasters, drawing on inherent magic from a gift or bloodline.
Your veins carry draconic magic, the result of a powerful dragon ancestor.
Your powers come from ancient forces of chaos. They churn within you - waiting to burst free at any time.
Bound by a pact to an all-powerful patron, warlocks trade their loyalty for supernatural abilities and unique magic.
You have pledged your soul to the Hells or Abyss in return for a deadly arsenal of fiendish arcana.
You pledged something unthinkable to an unspeakably ancient entity - which in return furnished you with powers of cerebral entropy and control.
Wizards master the arcane by specialising in individual schools of magic, combining ancient spells with modern research.
You twist and harden the Weave into arcane wards to protect yourself and others. Learning Abjuration spells from scrolls only costs you 25g per spell level, not 50.
You are known as an evoker - striding unharmed through the unfettered chaos you call. Learning Evocation spells from scrolls only costs you 25g per spell level, not 50.
Deal extra damage to a foe you that is in melee range of an ally.
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target and you don't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Deal extra damage to a foe you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> against.
You can also use this attack if you have an ally within [1] of the target and you don't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Shoot a green arrow that covers the target and the ground with acid. Deals [1] immediately and [2] at the end of the target's turn.
Shoot a green arrow that covers the target and the ground with acid. Deals [1] immediately and [2] at the end of the target's turn.
Hurl a sphere that deals [1] and possibly creates a surface on impact. Alternatively, choose a different type of damage.
Hurl caustic energy that damages the target and creates an <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ACID">Acid</LSTag> surface on impact.
Hurl freezing energy that damages the target and creates a frosty surface to knock creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Hurl fiery energy that damages the target and creates a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag> surface on impact.
Hurl lightning energy that damages the target and creates an electrified surface on impact.
Hurl poisonous energy that damages the target and creates a bubbling surface to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag> creatures.
Hurl a sphere of thunderous energy.
The next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against this target has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
The next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against this target has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
The next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against this target has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
The thorns deal [1] to the target and then explode. The explosion deals an additional [2] to the target and surrounding creatures.
Link yourself to a target with a bolt of lightning. Deal an additional [1] each turn by activating it.
Link yourself to a target with a bolt of lightning. Deal an additional [1] each turn by activating it.
Link yourself to a target with a bolt of lightning. Deal an additional [1] each turn by activating it.
Weaken a foe: they deal half damage with weapon attacks using <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>.
Shoot a bright flame from your fingers that explodes upon contact, torching everything in the vicinity.
The glyphs explode and hurt everyone within range when stepped on by an enemy.
The glyphs emit a gust of wind that pushes everyone back when stepped on by an enemy.
The glyphs emit a soothing magic that puts everyone within range to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SLEEP">Sleep</LSTag> when stepped on by an enemy.
Hurl a flask of liquid fire that explodes on impact.
Hurl an acid vial that explodes on impact.
Aim two attacks at a target.
Shoot [2] magical darts, each dealing [1]. They always hit their target.
Shoot [2] magical darts, each dealing [1]. They always hit their target.
Shoot [2] magical darts, each dealing [1]. They always hit their target.
Move up to your speed of <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement speed</LSTag>.
Creature has one extra action each turn.
Muster up your stamina to heal yourself.
Can only be used once per Rage.
Conjure a flaming scimitar in your hand that deals [1] and sheds bright light in a [2] radius and dim light in a [3] radius.
The blade can be unequipped and equipped again, but has to stay on the spellcaster's person.
Heal yourself and all nearby allies for [1]. Regain another [1] next turn.
Protective shadows surround you. They increase your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by 3.
Create 3 illusory duplicates of yourself that distract attackers. Each duplicate increases your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by 3.
Whenever you successfully evade an attack, one of the duplicates disappears.
Whenever you successfully evade an attack, one of the duplicates disappears.
Deal [1] extra damage with melee and improvised weapons and thrown weapons.

Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to physical damage, and <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> turns into a frenzy! You gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FrenziedStrike">Frenzied Strike</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Throw_FrenziedThrow">Enraged Throw</LSTag>. You can also make an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Throw_ImprovisedWeaponBerserker">Improvised Weapon Attack</LSTag> as a bonus action.
Enter a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> that makes you tough enough to stand up to any punishment.
You can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_FerociousAppetite">Unrelenting Ferocity</LSTag>, and have Resistance to all damage except Psychic damage.
A protective shell envelops you. It reflects any projectiles targeted at you back to their point of origin.
Draw on your stamina to heal yourself.
Your staff or club becomes magical: it deals [1], and uses your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> for <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Call forth spirits to protect you. Nearby enemies take [1] or [2] per turn, and their <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> is halved.
Magically assume the shape of a beast.

While in animal shape, you can't talk or cast spells. You take on the attributes of your beast form - excluding your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.

When your beast form drops to 0 hit points, you revert to your normal form.
Heal your allies and increase their hit point maximum by [1].
Heal your allies and increase their hit point maximum by [1].

Your allies will regain the maximum <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> possible when healed. They also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> and Death Saving Throws.
Channel fey magic to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charm</LSTag> nearby beasts and plants.
Let your darkest emotions burst forth as a menacing pulse to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frighten</LSTag> nearby enemies.
You and nearby allies gain <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to Falling damage.
You and nearby allies gain <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to Falling damage.
You and nearby allies gain <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to Falling damage.
Heal all allies you can see.
Draw on the Plane of Fire to melt the ground and create a small lava surface under you.
Dismiss yourself from your summoner's service.
Grow in size to become stronger.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> using Strength, and weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4 damage.
Let the rage build within you. Once it overflows, you'll be able to attack multiple times per turn.
Filled with a furious anger, the gnoll can attack multiple times on its turn.
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> by 3, at the cost of decreasing your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by 1.
Bolster nearby allies with a supernatural resolve. Their attacks deal an additional [1].

Bolster nearby allies with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HOBGOBLIN_LEADERSHIP">Leadership</LSTag> and mark nearby non-believers as the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HOBGOBLIN_LEADERSHIP_ENEMY">Absolute's Enemy</LSTag>.
Go into a frenzy, increasing your size and becoming stronger through raw anger.

While raging, your melee attacks deal an additional [1].

You gain Resistance to physical damage, and Advantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.

You can use Frenzied Strike.
Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. Attackers also gain Advantage on Attack Rolls against you.
Emanate a static discharge that buffs nearby constructs and hurts all others.
Nearby constructs deal an additional [2] to weapon attacks. All others take [1] per turn and can't take reactions.
Stomp the ground to cause a massive shockwave and knock nearby creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a wolf.
Take the shape of a white wolf.
You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls.
Bless allies within 15 feet. They gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Gains a +1 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Each flammable target is hit with [1].
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="COLOR_SPRAY">Blind</LSTag> creatures up to a combined [1].

Targets drop everything and become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Fearful</LSTag>: they have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
If the target ends their turn where they can't see you, they can make another <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> to shake off their fear.
Summon a strong wind that clears all clouds and pushes creatures back [1], forcing them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="OFF_BALANCED">Off Balance</LSTag>.
Release a wave of thunderous force that pushes away all creatures and objects.
Affected entity has -2 to Attack Rolls, AC, and Saving Throws.

<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blind</LSTag> a creature. <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against it have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and the foe attacks with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charm</LSTag> a humanoid to prevent it from attacking you. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> in dialogue.
Enemies have Advantage on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being Charmed.
You and your allies are revitalised as though you would have taken a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls
You inspire yourself and your allies with words or tunes of encouragement. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls.
You are an expert with weapons and gain a +2 to hit with them.
You are a master with weapons and gain a +2 to hit with them.
You are an expert in reflex saving throws and have a +2 bonus to them.
You are an expert in fortitude saving throws and have a +2 bonus to them.
You are an expert in will saving throws and have a +2 bonus to them.
You are a master in reflex saving throws and have a +2 bonus to them.
You are a master in fortitude saving throws and have a +2 bonus to them.
You are a master in will saving throws and have a +2 bonus to them.
Character creation ability scores can't be changed, so this gives a +2 bonus to all ability scores.
Your reflexes are as effective as any armour. While not wearing armour, you add +2 to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
Throw a shard of ice that deals [1]. It explodes and deals [2] to anyone nearby. It leaves an ice surface.
This spell can be cast while you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag>.
Strike an enemy with lightning. Three more bolts will leap from the target, electrifying as many as three other enemies within [1].
Hurl a sphere that deals [1] and possibly creates a surface on impact.
Shoot a thin green ray from your finger. If the [1] reduces the target to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, it disintegrates into a crumbly ash.
Launch a ball of churning ice that explodes and damages all creatures and objects within range.
Launch a ball of churning ice that explodes and damages all creatures and objects within range.
Throw a shard of ice that deals [1]. It explodes and deals [2] to anyone nearby. It leaves an ice surface.
This spell can be cast while you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag>.

This spell can be cast while you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag>.
Throw a shard of ice that deals [1]. It explodes and deals [2] to anyone nearby. It leaves an ice surface.
This spell can be cast while you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag>.
Call forth the cold mountain winds and reduce the target's <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [1].
Expel the needles from your body towards a creature.
Leap at a target to bite it and knock it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Ice-cold flames shed light in a [2] radius. You take only <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">half the damage</LSTag> of all Fire damage, and deal [1] to anyone who hits you with a melee attack.
Scorching flames shed light in a [2] radius. You take only <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">half the damage</LSTag> of all Cold damage, and deal [1] to anyone who hits you with a melee attack.
Become able to see <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> creatures, and possibly reveal them to others.
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.
Expend a Level 4 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> to heal yourself.
Expend a Level 5 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> to heal yourself.
Expend a Level 6 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> to heal yourself.
Take the shape of an air myrmidon.

Your air myrmidon shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels. It can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Invisibility">Invisibility</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_LightningStrike_Myrmidon_Air">Electrified Flail</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_RagingVortex_Myrmidon_Air">Raging Vortex</LSTag>.
Take the shape of an earth myrmidon.

Your earth myrmidon shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels. It can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_MetalCoating_Myrmidon_Earth">Muck to Metal</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_MudSlap_Myrmidon_Earth">Sludgy Sling</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Burrow_Myrmidon_Earth">Burrow</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a fire myrmidon.

Your fire myrmidon shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels. It can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FieryStrike_Myrmidon_Fire">Scorching Strike</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_BurningRage_Myrmidon_Fire">Myrmidon's Immolation</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_RangedSwipe_Myrmidon_Fire">Cinderous Swipe</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a water myrmidon.

Your water myrmidon shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels. It can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FreezingStrike_Myrmidon_Water">Hiemal Strike</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_HealingMist_Myrmidon_Water">Healing Vapours</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_ExplosiveIcicle_Myrmidon_Water">Explosive Icicle</LSTag>.
Create a shockwave of either divine or malevolent thunder that damages nearby creatures and possibly knocks them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Emit a shockwave of malevolent thunder that damages nearby creatures and possibly knocks them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Emit a shockwave of divine thunder that damages nearby creatures and possibly knocks them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.

You and everyone around can't be poisoned, diseased, or frightened. Your <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">HP</LSTag> increases, and you make Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saves</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
End your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BULWARK_MODE">Defensive Protocol: Bulwark</LSTag> and return to your normal combat calibration.
Expel a wave of force to push assailants back [1] and knock them <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Emit the stench of tomb mould and abattoirs to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STINKING_CLOUD">Nauseate</LSTag> nearby foes.
Nausea can be cleared if targets become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="WET">Wet</LSTag>.
Brand nearby creatures with a sinister mark so that their deaths make you harder to kill.
Marked targets are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DAZED">Dazed</LSTag>, and when they die, you gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
Gales of crackling stormy wind swirl around you, battering at nearby creatures and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SHOCKED">Shocking</LSTag> them.
Give in to the owlbear's base instincts to increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> by [1] and possibly make nearby creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Fearful</LSTag>.
Immune to Magic Missile. <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> is increased by 1.
Gains a +1d4 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
Weapon has become magical, receiving a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack</LSTag> and deals an extra die of damage.
Has a 1d4 penalty to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag> a target and possibly afflict them with a disease of your choice.

The target receives <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, and is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag>.
Hot fingers of pain push through the creature's eyes, impairing its <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>.

The target receives <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> that use Strength.
Fever squeezes huge drops of thick oily sweat from the creature's pores, impairing its <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>.

The target receives <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> and is afflicted with <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerability</LSTag> to all damage.
The creature begins to mortify, becoming a festering flesh sack propped up by bones, impairing its <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag>.

The target receives <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, and is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TIMMASK_SPORES">Befuddled</LSTag>.
The creature's brain begins to cook in a rancid stew of hot sour blood, impairing its <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>.

The target receives <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Spasms rack the creature, impairing its <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>.

The target receives <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Whenever they are hit, they get <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunned</LSTag>.
Fever squeezes huge drops of thick oily sweat from the creature's pores, impairing its <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>.
Protect a creature from death. The next time damage would reduce it to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, it remains conscious with 1 hit point left.

The fury of a wild predator fills you when you Rage, granting you ferocious unarmed attacks. Cultures that revere vicious animals (such as apes or bears) give rise to barbarians with this instinct. You might also be at war with an uncontrollable, animalistic side of your personality, or you might be a descendant of a werewolf or another werecreature.
While raging, you gain your chosen animal’s unarmed attack (or attacks), but you’re unable to use weapons.

You might also be at war with an uncontrollable, animalistic side of your personality, or you might be a descendant of a werewolf or another werecreature.
While raging, you gain your chosen animal’s unarmed attack (or attacks), but you’re unable to use weapons. The specific attack gained, the damage it deals, and its traits are listed in the Animal Instincts table. These attacks are in the brawling group. Your Rage action gains the morph and primal traits

With a sudden shout, a well-timed taunt, or a cutting put-down, you can shake an enemy's resolve. Choose a creature within 30 feet of you who you're aware of. Success The target becomes frightened 1.

You can quickly fire multiple shots with greater control. When you use Double Shot, you can make the attacks against the same target. You can add an additional action to Double Shot to make three ranged Strikes instead of two. If you do, the penalty is –4. All attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn’t increase until after you’ve made all of them.

1 Action
Press
Your offense exploits your enemy’s fear. Make a melee Strike against a frightened creature. If you hit and deal damage, the target becomes off-guard until next turn.

1 Action
Stance
You adopt a stance to rebound your thrown weapons toward you. While you are in this stance, your main hand weapon will return to you after being thrown.
You can use your shield to fend off explosions and the like. When you Raise your Shield, you gain your shield’s circumstance bonus to Reflex saves.
The urge to fight drives you ever forward. You gain a +10 bonus to your speed.

Requirements Vicious Swing
You’ve learned to maintain your balance even when swinging furiously. When you make a Vicious Swing with a melee weapon you’re wielding in two hands, it counts as one attack toward your multiple attack penalty instead of two.

1 Action
Press
Requirements The creature is grabbed
You pummel a held foe, hoping to stagger them. Make a melee Strike against a creature you have grabbed. The weapon damage from this Strike is bludgeoning damage. If the Strike hits, the creature must attempt a Fortitude save against your class DC.
Success Stunned 1
Failure Stunned 2

1 Action
Press
After compromising your enemy’s movement, you deliver a more deadly blow. Make a Strike against a creature that is grabbed, prone, or restrained. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to damage
The Strike gains the following failure effect. Failure You deal 2 damage.

2 Actions
You make a wide, arcing swing. Make a melee Strike and compare the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within your melee reach and adjacent to each other.

2 Actions
You make an attack to knock a foe off balance, then follow up immediately with a sweep to topple them. Make a melee Strike. If it hits and deals damage, you can attempt an Athletics check to Trip the creature you hit. If you’re wielding a two-handed melee weapon, you can ignore Trip’s requirement that you have a hand free. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn’t increase until after you’ve made both of them.

1 Action
Flourish, Press
Requirements Two enemies in melee range
You turn your foes’ flanking against them with a quick reverse. Make a melee Strike against one of the flanking enemies and make a second Strike with the same weapon or unarmed attack against a different enemy that is flanking you. This second Strike has the same multiple attack penalty of the initial attack and doesn’t count toward your multiple attack penalty.

2 Actions
Requirements Using a ranged weapon with reload 0
You shoot twice in blindingly fast succession. Make two Strikes, each against a separate target and with a –2 penalty. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn’t increase until after you’ve made both of them.

1 Action
Requirements Using a one handed weapon and have a free hand
You can parry attacks against you with your one-handed weapon. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn as long as you continue to meet the requirements.
Pathfinder has a base DC of 10 instead of 8.

2 Actions
Requirements Using a thrown weapon
You bounce your weapon off one foe to strike another. Make a ranged Strike with a thrown weapon. If this Strike hits, the weapon rebounds toward an enemy within 10 feet of the original target. Make an additional Strike against this second target. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn’t increase until after you’ve made both attacks.

1 Action
You attack an enemy at the edge of your reach. Make a Strike with a melee weapon, increasing your reach by 5 feet for that Strike.

2 Actions
Your blow not only wounds creatures but also shatters their confidence. Make a melee Strike. If you hit and deal damage, the target is frightened 1.

1 Action
Press
You aim your weapon to snag a foe's armor, clothing, or flesh to pull them closer. Make a melee Strike. If you hit a target, that creature is flat-footed until the end of your current turn, and you can move it 5 feet toward you.
Failure The target becomes flat-footed until the end of your current turn.

1 Action
Press
Requirements You have one hand free
Using your prior attack to shift your opponent’s guard, you take another swing and grab them. Make a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, you grab the target using your free hand.

1 Action
Press
Requirements Using a two-handed weapon
Using the momentum of your last attack to throw your weight into another, you make your opponent stumble back. Make a Strike with a two-handed melee weapon. If you hit, that creature is off-guard until the end of your current turn, and you automatically Shove it.
This Strike has the following failure effect. Failure The target becomes off-guard until the end of your current turn.

1 Action
Press
Requirements Using a ranged weapon
Using your last shot to gauge your accuracy, you can fire off a quick shot to interfere with a foe in combat. Make a Strike with a ranged weapon. If the Strike hits, the next creature other than you to attack the same target before the start of your next turn gains a +1 circumstance bonus to their roll, or a +2 circumstance bonus if your Strike was a critical hit.

2 Actions
Requirements Using a melee weapon
You unleash a particularly powerful attack that clobbers your foe but leaves you a bit unsteady. Make a melee Strike. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty. If this Strike hits, you deal an extra die of weapon damage. If you’re at least 10th level, increase this to two extra dice, and if you’re at least 18th level, increase it to three extra dice.

2 Actions
Requirements Using a melee weapon
With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing. Stride twice. If you end your movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, you can make a melee Strike against that enemy. You can use Sudden Charge while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

1 Action
You combine an attack with quick grappling moves to throw an enemy off balance as long as it stays in your reach. Make a Strike while keeping one hand free. If this Strike hits, the target is off-guard until the start of your next turn or until it’s no longer within the reach of your hand, whichever comes first.

1 Action
While in this stance and using a ranged weapon that doesn’t have the volley trait, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls on attacks against targets within the weapon’s first range increment.

2 Actions
Requirements You are wielding two weapons
You lash out at your foe with both weapons. Make two Strikes, one with each of your two melee weapons, each using your current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target. If the second Strike is made with a weapon that doesn’t have the agile trait, it takes a –2 penalty.

2 Actions
You make an attack to knock a foe off balance, then follow up immediately with a sweep to topple them. Make a melee Strike. 1 Action
Prerequisites You are unarmored Your arms flutter like a crane’s wings. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC, but the only Strikes you can make are crane wing attacks. These deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits. While in Crane Stance, reduce the DC for High Jump and Long Jump by 5, and when you Leap, you can move an additional 5 feet horizontally or 2 feet vertically.
When you are raging, your visual senses improve, granting you darkvision.

Your fury fills your foes with fear. While you are raging, your Demoralize and Scare to Death actions (from the Intimidation skill and an Intimidation skill feat, respectively) gain the rage trait, allowing you to use them while raging.

Thrown weapons become especially deadly in your fury. You apply the additional damage from Rage to your thrown weapon attacks. If you have the Brutal Critical feat or the devastator class feature, apply their benefits to thrown weapon attacks.

1 Action
Desperate to finish the fight, you pour all your rage into one final blow. Make a Strike. If it hits, you an additional 1d10 damage. After this Strike, your Rage immediately ends, and you are fatigued until you rest.

You can enter a second rage, but afterward you need to catch your breath. When you Rage, you can choose to gain temporary HP from the Rage even if 1 minute hasn’t passed (or a full turn if you have the revitalizing rage class feature). If you do, once this Rage ends you become fatigued until you rest for 10 minutes

2 Actions
With a great heave, you seize a piece of your surroundings, such as a boulder, log, table, wagon, or chunk of earth, and hurl it at your foes. The object must be your size or one size smaller than you, and it must not have too much Bulk for you to lift it in the first place. Make a ranged Strike with the object; regardless of the result, the object takes the same amount of damage it would deal on a success. The object is a simple ranged weapon that deals 1d10 bludgeoning damage, has a range increment of 20 feet, and has the thrown weapon trait. The damage increases to 2d10 if you have weapon specialization in simple weapons, or 3d10 if you have greater weapon specialization

Your proficiency in unarmored defense increases to expert. When you are raging and unarmored, your skin transforms into a thick hide. You gain a +2 item bonus to AC (+3 if you have the greater juggernaut class feature). The thickness of your hide gives you a Dexterity modifier cap to your AC of +3. This item bonus to AC is cumulative with armor potency runes on your explorer’s clothing, mystic armor, and bands of force

2 Actions
Frequency Once per 10 minutes
You breathe deeply and exhale powerful energy in a 30-foot cone, dealing 1d6 damage per level to each creature in the area with a basic Reflex save against your class DC. The damage type matches your instinct’s dragon breath (page 75), and this action gains the trait of your dragon instinct’s tradition.

You grow to incredible size. You become Large, increasing your reach by 5 feet and gaining the clumsy 1 condition until you stop raging. Your equipment grows with you.

2 Actions

1 Action
Prerequisites You are unarmored You enter the stance of an implacable mountain—a technique created by dwarven monks—allowing you to strike with the weight of an avalanche and block blows with your garments. The only Strikes you can make are falling stone unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage; are in the brawling group; and have the forceful, nonlethal, and unarmed traits. While in Mountain Stance, you gain a +4 item bonus to AC and a +2 circumstance bonus to any defenses against Reposition, Shove, Trip, and other forced movement effects. You have a Dexterity modifier cap to your AC of +0, meaning you don’t add your Dexterity to your AC, and your Speeds are all reduced by 5 feet. The item bonus to AC from Mountain Stance is cumulative with armor potency runes on your explorer’s clothing, mystic armor, and bands of force.

On a critical success with your tiger claws, if you deal damage, the target takes 1d4 persistent bleed damage. As long as your Speed is at least 20 feet while in Tiger Stance, you can Step 10 feet.

You have trained with the weaponry of your monastery or school. You gain access to uncommon weapons with the monk trait and become trained in simple and martial monk weapons. When your proficiency for unarmed attacks increases to expert or master, your proficiency rank for these weapons increases to expert or master as well. If you have familiarity with an agile or finesse weapon (such as from the Catfolk Weapon Familiarity feat), that weapon also gains the monk trait for you. You can use melee monk weapons with any of your monk feats or monk abilities that normally require unarmed attacks, though not if the feat or ability requires you to use a single specific type of attack, such as Crane Stance.
Your attack summons thorny vines that possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARING_STRIKE">Ensnare</LSTag> your target.

Transform yourself or an ally into a tiny gas cloud. It can't fall, and fits through small openings. It is very hard to damage.

Like a powerful constrictor, you crush targets in your unyielding grasp. When you successfully Grapple a creature, you can deal bludgeoning damage to that creature equal to your Strength modifier. You can make this attack nonlethal with no penalty

The focused power of your flurry threatens to overwhelm your opponent. When you target the same creature with two Strikes from your Flurry of Blows, you can try to stun the creature. If either Strike hits and deals damage, the target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1 (or stunned 3 on a critical failure). This is an incapacitation effect

1 Action
You enter a tightly coiled stance, with your hands poised as venomous fangs. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are cobra fang unarmed attacks. These deal 1d4 piercing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, deadly d10, finesse, unarmed, and venomous (page 119) traits. While in Cobra Stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves and your Fortitude DC, and you gain poison resistance equal to half your level

Reaction
You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, you have deflected it. You cannot use this feat to deflect unusually massive ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).
Your flurry is a combination of maneuvers. You can replace one or both of your attacks during a Flurry of Blows with Grapples, Repositions, Shoves, or Trips

2 Actions
You launch yourself at a foe. Make a Leap or attempt a High Jump or Long Jump. At the end of the jump, if you’re adjacent to a foe, you can immediately Strike that foe with an unarmed attack, even if the foe is in midair. You fall to the ground after the Strike. If the distance you fall is no more than the height of your jump, you land upright and take no damage.

You heal yourself. You regain 8 Hit Points.
Heightened (+1) If you choose to regain Hit Points, the Hit Points regained increase by 8.

1 to 3 Actions
Area 15-foot cone or more
Defense Fortitude
You unleash your qi as a powerful blast that deals 2d6 force damage. If you use 2 actions to cast qi blast, increase the size of the cone to 30 feet and the damage to 3d6. If you use 3 actions to cast qi blast, increase the cone to 60 feet and the damage to 4d6. Each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude save.
Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6, or by 2d6 if you use 2 or 3 actions

1 Action
The world seems to shrink before your footfalls. You teleport up to a distance equal to your Speed within your line of sight.

Prerequisites Crane Stance
Trigger You are targeted with an attack by an observed attacker.
Requirements You are in Crane Stance.
You interpose your arm between yourself and your opponent. Your circumstance bonus to AC from Crane Stance increases to +3 against the triggering attack. If the attack misses you and the attacker is within your reach, you can immediately make a crane wing Strike against the attacker at a –2 penalty

Prerequisites Dragon Stance
Requirements You are in Dragon Stance.
You bellow, instilling fear in your enemies. Enemies within a 15-foot emanation must succeed at a Will save against your Intimidation DC or be frightened 1 (frightened 2 on a critical failure). When a creature frightened by the roar begins its turn adjacent to you, it can’t reduce its frightened value below 1 on that turn. Your first attack that hits a frightened creature after you roar and before the end of your next turn gains a +4 circumstance bonus to damage. After you use Dragon Roar, you can’t use it again for 1d4 rounds. Its effects end immediately if you leave Dragon Stance. Creatures in the area are then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Prerequisites Mountain Stance
Requirements You are in Mountain Stance.
You focus on your connection to the earth and call upon the mountain to block attacks against you. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the beginning of your next turn. Special If you have this feat, the Dexterity modifier cap to your AC while you’re in Mountain Stance increases from +0 to +1

2 Actions or 3 Actions
You put all your force into a single mighty, carefully controlled blow. Make an unarmed Strike. If you spend two actions and this Strike hits, you deal an extra die of weapon damage. You can instead spend 3 actions to perform an even more powerful attack, dealing a second additional die of weapon damage on a hit. If you’re at least 10th level, the number of additional dice you add from this feat doubles, for a total of 2 additional dice if you spend 2 actions or 4 additional dice if you spend 3 actions. If you’re at least 18th level, the number of additional dice you add from this feat triples, for a total of 3 additional dice if you spend 2 actions or 6 additional dice if you spend 3 actions

Prerequisites Deflect Projectile, Monastic Archer Stance
Requirements You are in Monastic Archer Stance, are wielding a bow, and have a free hand.
Snatching an arrow out of the air, you instantly put it to your bow and return fire. When you successfully Deflect a Projectile that’s an arrow, as part of that reaction you can immediately make a ranged bow Strike from your own bow by firing the arrow you deflected.

2 Actions
Prerequisites Tiger Stance

You make a fierce swipe with both hands. Make a tiger claw Strike. It deals two extra weapon damage dice (three extra dice if you’re 14th level or higher), and you can push the target 5 feet away as if you had successfully Shoved them. If the attack is a critical success and deals damage, add your Strength modifier to the persistent bleed damage from your tiger claw

2 Actions

Destructive Vengeance Reaction
Trigger An enemy in your champion’s aura damages you;
Effect Bloodshed begets bloodshed as you drag your enemy toward oblivion. You increase the amount of damage you take by 1d6, and you deal 1d6 spirit damage to the triggering enemy. The damage you take and deal when you use this reaction increases to 2d6 at 5th level, 3d6 at 9th level, 4d6 at 12th level, 5d6 at 16th level, and 6d6 at 19th level

You always take what pleases you, no matter who it hurts, and you spread a malign influence across all you touch.
Edicts subvert or corrupt everything in your path that is pure or holy, sow doubt among those holding ideals of purity or holiness
Selfish Shield Reaction
Trigger An enemy in your champion’s aura damages you;
Effect Your self-interest keeps you safe. You gain resistance against the triggering damage equal to 2 + half your level, regardless of damage type.

The glowing grandeur of the immaculate celestial realms inspires you, and you exhort their virtues to bring humility to the denizens of other grim worlds.
Edicts provide a shining example for others, enjoy and share the beauty around you, keep yourself tidy and well groomed
Anathema despoil yourself by associating with fiends and unholy forces.
Flash of Grandeur
Reaction
Trigger An enemy damages your ally, and both are in your champion’s aura;
Effect Imperious divine light flashes out from you to surround your foe. The ally gains resistance to all damage against the triggering damage equal to 2 + your level.

In your deity’s name you seek justice, following the law and punishing those who transgress it.
Edicts follow the law, respect legitimate authorities or leadership
Anathema take advantage of another, cheat
Retributive Strike Reaction
Trigger An enemy damages your ally, and both are in your champion’s aura;
Effect You protect your ally and strike your enemy. The ally gains resistance to all damage against the triggering damage equal to 2 + your level. If the enemy is within reach, make a melee Strike against it.

You will see all people free from bondage and prohibitions.
Edicts oppose slavery and tyranny, fight for others’ freedom to make their own decisions, respect choices others make for their own lives
Anathema force or threaten someone to act a certain way, engage in slavery or tyranny
Liberating Step Reaction
Trigger An enemy damages your ally, and both are in your champion’s aura;
Effect You free an ally from restraint.
The ally gains resistance to all damage against the triggering damage equal to 2 + your level.

Society is ordered with good reason, and people should conduct themselves as appropriate for their proper place.
Edicts enforce proper hierarchies, topple illegitimate hierarchies, lead when you’re the most suited to the task
Anathema let one who is lesser than you wield power over you or lead you
Iron Command Reaction
Trigger An enemy in your champion’s aura damages you;
Effect You put an impertinent foe who dared harm you in their proper place. You command your enemy to kneel before you in obedience. If they dare to refuse, they must pay the price in pain and anguish.
You deal 1d6 mental damage to the enemy. This damage increases to 2d6 at 5th level, 3d6 at 9th level, 4d6 at 12th level, 5d6 at 16th level, and 6d6 at 19th level.

Yearning for all to live in harmony, you make every attempt to redeem those others might slay or dismiss.
Edicts try to redeem those who commit wicked deeds, show compassion to others regardless of their authority or station
Anathema kill a sapient enemy without first offering a chance at redemption
Glimpse Of Redemption Reaction

Effect Your enemy hesitates under the weight of sin as visions of redemption play in their mind’s eye.
The ally gains resistance to all damage against the triggering damage equal to 2 + your level.

You Raise your Shield, causing ephemeral spirit shields to float within your champion’s aura. The shields last until the start of your next turn or until you’re no longer raising your shield, whichever comes first. While one of your allies is in your champion’s aura, the shields grant them a +1 status bonus to AC, and each time an enemy makes an attack against the ally, the enemy takes 1d4 spirit damage (even if it misses). The benefit applies only while an ally is in your aura, ending for any ally that leaves and applying to any that enters later. As normal, you don’t count as your own ally and therefore don’t get the benefits of the spirit shields yourself

Healing Font: You gain 4 additional spell slots each day at your highest rank of cleric spell slots. You can prepare only heal spells in these slots. At 5th level, the number of additional slots increases to 5, and at 15th level, the total number of additional slots increases to 6.

Harmful Font: You gain 4 additional spell slots each day at your highest rank of cleric spell slots. You can prepare only harm spells in these slots. At 5th level, the number of additional slots increases to 5, and at 15th level, the total number of additional slots increases to 6.
